name: Karl heinrich Marx
description:
Karl heinrich Marx[11] (German: [man]; May 5, 1818-14 March 1883) was a philosopher, an economist, a historian, a political theorist, sociologist, German journalist and revolutionary socialist.
 
 Born in the trier into a middle-class family Marx studied law and philosophy Hegelian. Because of his political publication, Marx became a non-state living in exile in London, where he kept developing his mind in collaborating with the German thinker friedrich Engels and publishing his writings, doing research in the British museum's den. His famous work was the 1848 pamphlet, the communist manifesto, and the work of the three volumes of das kapital. Its political and philosophical thinking has had an effect on the intellectual, economic and political history of the next and its name is used as an adjective, pronouncing and flowing social theory.
